newsitem.title: USA: Microsoft in PC game publishing pact.
newsitem.headline: Microsoft in PC game publishing pact.

text.p: Microsoft Corp's games group said Wednesday it had entered into a long-term publishing agreement with Digital Anvil, a computer game development company based in Austin, Texas.

Terms of the multi-title publishing deal were not disclosed, but Microsoft said it includes a significant minority investment by Microsoft and ensures that Digital Anvil will work exclusively with Microsoft to produce games for PC and online platforms.
Digital Anvil is led by Chris Roberts, Tony Zurovec and Erin Roberts, former designers for Electronic Arts Inc.
Microsoft and Digital Anvil's first produced titles, due in 1998, will be in the action-story and action-strategy genres, with an emphasis on 3-D, multiplayer and cinematic presentation.
